heading: seaside sentinel
subheading: the historic cape hatteras lighthouse, located in buxton, north carolina, has reached its new resting place a week ahead of schedule. after years of coastal erosion, the 129-year-old structure was in danger of falling into the ocean. the lighthouse completed its 2,900-foot, hydraulic journey on a set of rails and now rests safely 1,600 feet away from the atlantic. construction begins soon on a new brick foundation. the lighthouse will be lit and open to the public by memorial day 2000.
author: wired staff
